page.title: 07Bakewell Show
page.content: { Bakewell Show}is held every August. It used to be the largest one-day show in Britain, and was known as the {"Little Royal", }but now it lasts two days. Although mainly an{Agricultural {Show,}it caters for all interests, and includes displays, sideshows, stalls, competitions and a fair. Recent examples of displays have included police dogs, hot-air balloons and falconry. Very often it seems to rain, but that doesn't stop as many as 40000 tourists from pouring in to see Bakewell Show. Competition for best livestock prizes is very fierce and entries are attracted from all over Britain. The Bakewell Show was first held in 1843 and was organised by local farmers.
